alert.note: Alert for Northern Cayuga; Wayne (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 18 at 5:42AM EST until February 18 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: .Heavy rain combined with rapid snowmelt yesterday resulted in excessive runoff into streams, rivers, and low lying areas. The flood risk will continue today even as temperatures fall well below freezing. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff from widespread rain and snowmelt will continue to be possible today, even as temperatures drop well below freezing. * WHERE...Portions of central and western New York, including the following counties, in central New York, Jefferson, Lewis, Northern Cayuga and Oswego. In western New York, Ontario and Wayne. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Excessive runoff from heavy rain and snowmelt yesterday may result in flooding of streams, creeks, and low lying areas even as temperatures drop well below freezing today. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
